text: n the small bones in the middle ear; or mixed, meaning it is caused by a combination of inner ear and middle ear abnormalities. Some affected people have tiny holes in the skin or extra bits of tissue just in front of the ear. These are called preauricular pits and preauricular tags, respectively.  ""Renal"" refers to the kidneys; BOR syndrome (but not BO syndrome) causes abnormalities of kidney structure and function.
